title: Remote Code Execution in Log4j Core
description: Log4j2 versions prior to 2.17.1 are vulnerable to remote code execution via JNDI lookup injection (Log4Shell).

title: SQL Injection in TransactionDAO.findByUserId
description: User-controlled input is concatenated directly into a SQL query string without parameterization.

title: Deserialization Vulnerability in Jackson Databind
description: Jackson-databind before 2.14.0 allows polymorphic deserialization of untrusted data, leading to remote code execution.

title: Hardcoded Database Password in DatabaseConfig
description: Database connection password is hardcoded as a string literal instead of being read from environment variables.

title: Multiple CVEs in Spring Boot Starter Web
description: Spring Boot Starter Web 2.7.0 contains multiple vulnerabilities including request smuggling and denial of service.

title: Unencrypted PAN Storage in Transaction Entity
description: Credit card primary account numbers are stored in the database without encryption or tokenization.

title: Missing Audit Logging on Payment Endpoints
description: Payment processing endpoints do not log access events required for PCI-DSS compliance auditing.

title: SQL Injection in User Search Endpoint
description: Raw SQL query constructed using f-string interpolation with unsanitized user input from query parameters.

title: SSRF Vulnerability in Requests Library
description: Requests library before 2.31.0 is vulnerable to server-side request forgery when handling redirects.

title: PII Logged in User Registration Flow
description: User email addresses and phone numbers are written to application logs during the registration flow.

title: Security Bypass in Flask Framework
description: Flask versions before 2.3.3 have a vulnerability that allows certain security mechanisms to be bypassed.

title: Hardcoded JWT Secret Key in Configuration
description: JWT signing secret is hardcoded in the application configuration file instead of using environment variables.

title: XSS via Template Injection in Jinja2
description: Jinja2 before 3.1.3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting when the sandbox mode is not enabled.

title: Unencrypted Password Reset Tokens
description: Password reset tokens are stored in plaintext in the database without hashing or encryption.

title: Prototype Pollution in Lodash
description: Lodash before 4.17.21 is vulnerable to prototype pollution via the merge and zipObjectDeep functions.

title: Reflected XSS in Product Search Response
description: User-supplied search query is reflected in the HTML response without proper output encoding.

title: Path Traversal in File Download Endpoint
description: User-supplied filename parameter is used to construct file paths without sanitization allowing directory traversal.

title: Missing Access Logging on Admin API Routes
description: Administrative API routes for catalog management lack access logging for security audit compliance.

title: Customer PII Exposed in Request Logging Middleware
description: HTTP request logging middleware logs full request bodies, including customer names and addresses.

title: SSRF Vulnerability in Axios HTTP Client
description: Axios before 1.6.0 is vulnerable to server-side request forgery via crafted URLs.
